column4: because the parition on my first harddrive is named the ubuntu drive name I can't format the partition they are both /dev/sda3 which is weird how do I fix this?
your question makes no sense. /dev/xxxx are devices, not mount-points, use "sudo fdisk -l" to check what device your harddisk is on
you cannot have to devices with the same device-name period
check "sudo fdisk -l"
don't mount anything you want to put a filesystem on

I think I know whats going on here, it says the live cd is mounted on a ext3 but that isn't possible last night I install this cd on my hard drive just the live squash version and evendtually this live disk DVD thinks its on the hard drive I will fix this

thanks :)
